how to setup tests in a server environment?You can use servletui, which is
in http unit testing package if you go to junit.org you would find some
links pointing to this.

THank
Babu
  -----Original Message-----
  From: Andy Kriger [mailto:akriger@...]
  Sent: Wednesday, March 14, 2001 1:02 PM
  To: JUnit (E-mail)
  Subject: [junit] how to setup tests in a server environment?


  I would like to use JUnit to run tests in our current dev environement but
I'm not sure how to proceed. We use WebLogic as our web/JSP server. On this
server we are running a set of WebLogic services that retrieve data from our
databases. I want to test the objects that interact with those services.
This means I have to have create the objects within the WebLogic context (as
servlets or in JSP files).

  Is there a way to take advantage of JUnit's testing framework (including
the assertions, logging of problems and the display of results) from within
a servlet? Has anyone written a TestCase/TestSuite servlet?

  Andy Kriger


        Yahoo! Groups Sponsor

        Click Here to Find Software Faster


  To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
  junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
